welcome.title: Welcome to Portfolio Manager
welcome.subtitle: A professional, multi-platform workspace for portfolio intelligence

setup.title: Configure your workspace
setup.description: Choose language, base currency, and optional API keys. Your settings sync instantly across desktop and mobile layouts.

import.title: Import from broker statements
import.description: Import CSV/PDF files from supported brokers, preview parsed rows, and handle duplicates with merge strategies before saving.

analysis.title: AI analysis and chat
analysis.description: Use Gemini-powered analysis, ask custom portfolio questions, and generate structured insights for risk, allocation, and performance.

tracking.title: Live pricing and performance
tracking.description: Track position prices with source badges and fallback logic: EODHD real-time -> FMP -> daily snapshot.

goals.title: Goals and rebalancing
goals.description: Set goal targets, follow progress, and use rebalancing tools to compare current allocation with desired weights.

market.title: Global market movers for free
market.description: Top gainers and losers are delivered daily from a public serverless snapshot. No API key is required for market movers.

security.title: Privacy-first key management
security.description: API keys are managed locally in app settings. You control providers, data refresh behavior, and when external requests are performed.

help.degiro: In DEGIRO: Activity > Account Statement > Export CSV
help.xtb: In XTB: History > Cash Operations > Export
help.revolut: In Revolut: Stocks > Statements > Export CSV

rebalancing.title: Rebalancing
rebalancing.subtitle: Set target percentages for your positions and see what to adjust

empty.title: No Portfolio
empty.description: Import a portfolio to start rebalancing your positions

help.title: How Rebalancing Works
help.description: This tab mirrors your portfolio positions and lets you define target weights. As you edit targets, current, target, and delta values update to show what to add or reduce.
help.step1: 1. Review each position's current allocation and value
help.step2: 2. Enter the target percentage you want for each position
help.step3: 3. Keep the total target at 100% using the summary card
help.step4: 4. Read the delta column to see how much to add or remove
help.step5: 5. "Reset to current allocation" copies current weights into all target fields
help.step6: 6. "Distribute equally" assigns the same target percentage to every position
help.step7: 7. Enable "Changes only" to show only positions where target and current differ

about.title: About
about.onboarding_reset_message: Onboarding has been reset. The app will reopen the onboarding flow.

getting_started.title: Getting Started
getting_started.content: Set up language, currency, portfolios, and optional API keys before your first analysis.
getting_started.details:
1. Open Settings > General and choose language + base currency
2. Create an empty portfolio or import one from broker files
3. Add Gemini API key in Settings > AI to unlock analysis and AI chat
4. (Optional) Add EODHD key for real-time position quotes
5. (Optional) Add FMP key as quote fallback
6. Open Market tab for free daily movers (no key required)
7. Re-run refresh after major trades

**Startup flow (technical):**
- Splash checks language selection and onboarding status
- Onboarding completion is stored locally
- Settings are loaded from local storage first, then optional compile-time env values

**Cross-device UX notes:**
- Mobile screens use scrollable cards and adaptive spacing
- Desktop/web full-width layouts preserve the same feature order and actions

importing.title: Importing Data
importing.content: Import CSV/PDF statements, preview parser results, and merge safely into portfolios.
importing.details:
**Supported flow**
1. Choose broker profile in Import page
2. Upload CSV or PDF documents
3. Review parsed positions before final save
4. Pick destination: new portfolio or existing portfolio
5. Resolve duplicate symbols with merge mode

**Duplicate handling modes**
- Ignore duplicates
- Replace existing rows
- Add quantities to existing rows

**Generic CSV minimum fields**
- Symbol
- Quantity
- Price or cost basis
- Currency (recommended)
- Exchange (recommended for better quote mapping)

**Common errors**
- Wrong decimal separators
- Extra header lines in exported files
- Missing symbol or quantity columns

analysis.title: Understanding Analysis and AI Chat
analysis.content: Learn how AI responses are generated, what inputs are used, and how quote sources affect results.
analysis.details:
**AI engine**
- Provider: Gemini API
- Default model: gemini-2.5-flash
- Configured with safety settings and token/temperature controls

**What the AI sees**
- Portfolio positions and allocation
- Cost basis and performance metrics
- Optional custom prompt entered by user

**What the AI does not do automatically**
- It does not place orders
- It does not connect to broker accounts directly
- It does not persist chat externally unless provider API logs requests

**Response quality tips**
- Keep symbols clean before import
- Ask explicit questions (risk, diversification, concentration)
- Refresh quotes before generating a new analysis

goals.title: Setting Goals
goals.content: Set investment targets and evaluate progress against real portfolio values.
goals.details:
1. Open Goals tab
2. Add a goal type and target amount
3. Set target date and optional monthly contribution
4. Compare target allocation vs current allocation
5. Re-sync after imports or manual position edits

**Advanced usage:**
- Use goals with rebalancing to convert high-level targets into position-level actions
- Keep contribution assumptions realistic and update periodically

rebalancing.title: Rebalancing Positions
rebalancing.content: Set desired weights and convert allocation gaps into actionable deltas.
rebalancing.details:
**Core mechanics**
- Current = latest portfolio allocation
- Target = desired allocation you edit
- Delta = difference between target and current

**Quick actions**
- Reset to current allocation
- Distribute equally
- Changes only filter

**Validation rules**
- Target sum should stay near 100%
- Over/under allocation warnings are shown in summary
- Save only after validation confirms consistency

**Practical tip**
Use rebalancing after big market moves or after adding new capital to avoid drift.

market_data.title: Market Data & Snapshots
market_data.content: Understand the difference between free public movers and optional private quote providers.
market_data.details:
**Free movers feed (no key)**
- Daily top gainers/losers are fetched from public distributed snapshot
- Timeframes: 1D, 5D, 1M, 1Y
- Markets currently covered: US, UK, Germany, France, Canada, Hong Kong, Australia, India

**Portfolio quote chain (optional keys)**
1. EODHD real-time quote
2. EODHD end-of-day fallback
3. FMP fallback
4. Snapshot price fallback

**Reliability safeguards**
- Volume filter applied to movers
- Staleness checks on quote dates
- Outlier blocking for suspicious jumps

data_pipeline.title: Data Pipeline (Technical)
data_pipeline.content: Technical overview of how market snapshots are built and deployed.
data_pipeline.details:
**Automation stack**
- GitHub Actions workflow runs on schedule, on main push, and manual dispatch
- Workflow injects secret EODHD_API_KEY
- Python script computes movers and writes snapshot artifacts

**Artifacts**
- Public JSON/zip data for app consumption
- Rolling 365-day history database for multi-period ranking
- Build logs uploaded as workflow artifacts

**Why this architecture**
- Keeps app startup fast
- Removes API-key requirement for public movers
- Centralizes heavy computation in CI rather than on user device

privacy_security.title: Privacy and Security
privacy_security.content: How credentials and local financial data are handled in the app.
privacy_security.details:
**Local persistence**
- App settings, onboarding status, and portfolio data are stored locally on device
- Clearing data removes local boxes and preferences

**API keys**
- Keys are entered by user in Settings
- Keys are only sent to selected provider endpoints when required
- App can run market movers without any personal key

**Operational best practices**
- Rotate keys periodically
- Avoid sharing screenshots that expose keys
- Use provider dashboards to revoke compromised keys

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.content: Fix common import, quote, and analysis issues quickly.
troubleshooting.details:
**Import issues**
- Verify broker format selection
- Remove duplicate headers and empty rows
- Check quantity/price numeric format

**No live prices**
- Confirm EODHD/FMP key is saved in Settings
- Verify exchange code mapping in position details
- Use refresh after updating keys

**AI analysis fails**
- Test Gemini connection in Settings
- Verify API key validity and quota
- Retry with a shorter prompt

**Unexpected UI behavior**
- Reopen onboarding from Settings > About
- Clear local data only if migration issues persist
- Re-import portfolio after data reset

glossary.title: Investment Glossary
glossary.content: Definitions of key portfolio analytics terms used across the app.
glossary.details:
**P&L**: Current value minus cost basis

**Cost Basis**: Original purchase value of a position

**Allocation**: Position weight relative to total portfolio value

**Volatility**: Dispersion of returns over time

**Drawdown**: Decline from local peak to subsequent trough

**Sharpe Ratio**: Return adjusted by total volatility

**Sortino Ratio**: Return adjusted by downside volatility only

**Beta**: Sensitivity versus benchmark market moves

**Alpha**: Excess return beyond model-expected return

**Base Currency**: Reporting currency used for totals and comparisons

charts.title: Portfolio Charts
charts.content: How to read treemaps and allocation tooltips.
charts.details:
**Positions Treemap**
Each rectangle represents a position; size shows weight on total value. Tap or hover for allocation and value.

**Geographic Treemap**
Positions are grouped by region (US, Europe, Asia, Rest of World, Liquidity, Commodities, Unassigned).

**Tips:**
- Large blocks indicate concentration risk
- Update your portfolio after trades to keep charts accurate
